page.title: 11THE OLD MANOR_INCE BLUNDELL
page.content:
{The old Manor house}is the most interesting historical building in the area.It was built around{1380}and stands inside the park wall.Itis built of browny_red brick with stone mullioned windows and stone quoined doors.The windows are set in the walls,following no set pattern.
Inside,the shape of the great hall can clearly be seen.The upper floor, was made of clay on oak batterns,has now disappeared but the remains of the beams and the spaces for the joists can still be seen.
There is one chimney and a fireplace at the kichen end.The Manor House is scheduled as a building of special interest.Unfortunately it has to be kept locked because of vandalism.
